Posts.Content: Yeah I agree I think its too soon but when I was at the hospital on friday my breast surgeon said that my plastic surgeon likes to start filling about 3/4 weeks after mx ! I'm more aprehensive with mt wound still being so raw and uncomfortable . Don't know what to do now as I have a lift arranged as hospital is an hour away from where I stay :(  Cathy x
Posts.Title: tissue expander implants

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, not been on this for a while after my mx on 18th dec..as I've had urine infection, constipation (which I still suffer from ) Was back at hospital on 3rd jan to get dressing removed and to get lymph node biopsy results, which I'm pleased to say were clear . Now I'm facing the long process of getting "pumped up" every week with my tissue expander implant - has anyone else had this done - if so how sore is it ? Dreading it tomorrow as wound is still a bit tender . thanks cathy x
Posts.Title: tissue expander implants

Posts.Content: Hi Emma, I get 50mls in mine every 2 weeks . I tend to use Bio Oil to massage my "boulder" as I'm finding the skin gets quite dry and it helps with scar as well . Not getting my exchange till late August / September at the earliest as my surgeon is fully booked up till then . I'm up at 500mls - hoping not much more saline to go in as I feel I'm going to pop ! How do you find sneezing ? I'm finding it quite uncomfortable much to the amusement of my hubby and kids when I do sneeze . Big hugs Cathy xx
Posts.Title: Expansion

Posts.Content: Getting so nervous/worried/anxious about my mastectomy and tissue expander operation on the 18th - the weeks have just flown in (too quick) think its the fear of the anaesthetic and the waking up to a different me and the pain that is to follow . I hate taking tablets even the very small ones - I gag something awful and 9 times out of 10 I give up :(  Packing my hospital bag tonight as I've got a sentinal lymph node biopsy tomorrow at 3pm . why can't I have one last day with "leftie" the way it is without another procedure getting done ?  Sorry for this wee rant - feel better for offloading , sorry Cathy x
Posts.Title: Upcoming mastectomy op on 18th

Posts.Content: Hi all, this might be a silly question but had my mx in dec 2013. Now getting the reconstruction as in tissue expander then permanent implant put in..anyway I'm currently up at 300mls and I'm now experiencing back pain . Don't know if this caused by the somewhat hard boulder I feel I have coming out of the top of my chest ! Or is it something random that is causing the now and again back pain ? I was a 34B but now I'm at 36C and bras feel quite uncomfortable after a few hours of wearing them.  Any help would be great if it doesn't clear up I'll make an appointment with GP . Thanks again wonderful people :-) Cathy x
Posts.Title: Back Pain

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, not been on for a while but have been popping in and out . I need some advice ..currently having saline in every 2 weeks (50mls) now up at 500mls so no much more to have put in . The problem I have is I'm finding wearing a bra so uncomfortable as I'm lopsided and I have the wee port thingy just under my ribs . Every bra/sport top the band digs in and makes it very uncomfortable to wear. If I wear a vest top (without a bra ) the lopsidedness is very noticeable especially in this nice weather we are having. I'm looking for a top with cups moulded in but cant seem to find any anywhere . Has anyone else have this problem ? I'm in glasgow. Dreading the summer now as I won't be having my reconstruction(permanent inplant) till late August/September . Hugs to you all xx Cathy
Posts.Title: tissue expander

Posts.Content: Thank you Alaval100 and Bongo56, been to John Lewis to get fitted for a bra and it did the trick for about a month but now its too uncomfortable to wear. Just been on the Amoena website and ordered myself a catalogue so hopefully I will find some stuff to wear - think I deserve to spoil myself a wee bit ! :-) Thank you both again xx Cathy
Posts.Title: tissue expander

Posts.Content: I just can't seem to be able to get a decent night's sleep after having mx last Wednesday . Here I am again this morning wide awake at 5.30 but only getting to bed at 2.30 and that was even with 3 hours down at the local A&E after drain had partially came out . Dozing during the day but nothing to make up ffor losing sleep at night . Hopefully once drain comes out tomorrow sleep will return .  Cathy x
Posts.Title: Can't sleep !

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  got home today after mastectomy on wed , only one drain in and still in - go to back on tues to get it removed.  Hopefully be a lot more comfortable - keep forgetting to carry the wee bag with drain in :(   I've been quite weepy today since I came home but have been told that is quite normal . Had 2 lymph nodes removed so get the results of them on the 3rd jan  - fingers crossed for that . Just going to my bed now so tired as didn't get much sleep in hospital .. Take care, Cathy x
Posts.Title: Home today !

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee,  sent you a friend request as I fancied doing the Moonwalk too and it would be great if we could get a wee group together . Strength in numbers and all that . I'm from Cumbernauld , slap bang in between glasgow and stirling so not too far . How do I go about signing up ?  Cathy x
Posts.Title: Almost 2 years on - the good things!

Posts.Content: That's brilliant news ! - Enjoy the cinema :-) x
Posts.Title: Radiology appt

Posts.Content: Hi kate, I too am having a mastectomy but with tissue expander reconstruction on the 18th Dec, like u I was worried about the pain, movement etc..but after being on this wonderful forum I am more reassured and don't in any way feel on my own . Hope everything goes okay for you which I am sure it will, and have a peaceful and restful Christmas . Take care Cathy x
Posts.Title: mastectomy on 20th December

Posts.Content: Hi there, I felt exactly like you are feeling..I too had high grade DCIS which was diagnosed in October 2013, followed by a mastectomy in December. Luckily lymph nodes were clear so no further treatment is needed. I am currently going through a reconstruction by way of tissue expander followed by implant . I too felt like a fraud by being on here but the support that I have received has helped me emotionally and practically has been brilliant..so keep posting how u feel even if its just to have a rant ! Also feel free to add me as friend as sometimes I still feel bewildered as to why they had to remove my breast if it was 'pre cancerous cells' Take care and hugs, Cathy x
Posts.Title: Feel like a fraud on this site

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  hope you all had a lovely Christmas . Well its been over a week kow since I had my mastectomy and reconstruction ,  still getting tired really quickly which I'm so not used to ! But back to the question - how long does the dressing have to stay on for ? I know my bc nurse told me but I can't remember . I was given another dressing home with me . I was going to get a bath tonight and was going to soak it off in bath .  Thanks  Cathy x
Posts.Title: post op mastectomy dressing
